title: How to write an editorial for publication - Quora

response.answer_text: Buy a newspaper. Some newspapers might let you write an op-ed piece for them, but generally speaking the editorial is the purview of the editor-in-chief or someone he designates as the newspaper’s “official” voice. Most newspapers have some form of “letters to the editor” — which is probably your best bet for getting your opinion published.

Check with the publication you'd like to write for to get their guidelines. They'll tell you whether they accept unsolicited contributions, what their restrictions on length are, whether there are rules about the kind of language you use, and to whom you should submit your copy.
